Today, Chicago is the a killing field of America. You would think he would find, assuming he can, a better place the preach the virtues of gun control. It is interesting to note that Chicago, and Illinois for that matter, have been run by Decmocrats since anyone can remember. They can't blame their mess on Republicans. I wonder who they blame?

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ... “If you want to have good ideas you must have many ideas. Most of them will be wrong, and what you have to learn is which ones to throw away.” – Linus Pauling “As our circle of knowledge expands, so does the circumference of darkness surrounding it.” – Albert Einstein "Monopoly is getting a big makeover. They want to make the Monopoly game more modern and bring it up to date to reflect our current culture. Like, in the new version of Monopoly, the banker never goes to jail." - Jay Leno “Just because you're miserable doesn't mean you can't enjoy your life.” – Annette Goodheart “Incomprehensible jargon is the hallmark of a profession.” – Kingman Brewster, Jr. "The Pope is resigning. I just hope it's not steroids…Apparently it's an old football injury from throwing all those Hail Marys…He said that at age 85 he cannot physically go on. Meanwhile, Hugh Hefner is going to be 87 and he just married a 26-year-old. So much for that celibate lifestyle!" - Jay Leno “There is no way I was buying my wife a freakin’ gun, because, let's be honest, there is no way I wasn't getting shot with that gun. Buying my wife a gun is sorta’ like me saying ‘Y'know, I kinda wanna kill myself...but I want it to be a surprise’.” – Marc Maron “Operationally, God is beginning to resemble not a ruler but the last fading smile of a cosmic Cheshire cat.” – Julian Huxley "The White House is warning North Korea that it will face significant consequences if it moves forward with a new round of nuclear tests. Not only that — it's also warning South Korea that it will face serious consequences if Psy makes another ad for pistachios." - Jimmy Fallon “Although I cannot lay an egg, I am a very good judge of omelettes” – George Bernard Shaw

Message.Title: AHQ (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ... “Numerous politicians have seized absolute power and muzzled the press. Never in history has the press seized absolute power and muzzled the politicians.” – Karl Otto von Schonhausen Bismarck “By and large, jazz has always been like the kind of a man you wouldn't want your daughter to associate with.” – Duke Ellington "President Obama gave his State of the Union address tonight. The rebuttal will be given by Marco Rubio. Or as he's known in the Republican Party, 'our black guy’.” - Conan O'Brien “I like to reminisce with people I don't know.” - Steven Wright “Anything which uses science as part of its name isn't: …political science, creation science, computer science.” – Hal Abelson "Following the State of the Union speech, Republicans gave their rebuttal. But yesterday Democrats held a press conference to deliver a pre-rebuttal to the Republicans' rebuttal. Democrats decided to preemptively rebut their rebuttal." - Jimmy Kimmel “The ‘paradox’ (quantum mechanics) is only a conflict between reality and your feeling of what reality ‘ought to be’.” – Richard Feynman “Monotheism is a gift from the Gods.” – anonymous "Pakistan is opening an amusement park and a zoo in the same town where the raid on Osama Bin Laden took place. The zoo is pretty cool, but I've heard you won't be able to see the seals until it's too late." - Jimmy Fallon “Just cause you got the monkey off your back doesn't mean the circus has left town.” – George Carlin

Message.Title: AHQ (3)...
Message.Msg: ... “If the people were a little more ignorant, astrology would flourish - if a little more enlightened, religion would perish” – Robert Green Ingersoll “When I say ‘mind’,” said the blood relation, ‘I refer to the quarter-teaspoonful of brain which you might possibly find in her head if you sank an artesian well.” – P.G. Wodehouse "A member of Congress is criticizing Steven Spielberg after he discovered parts of the movie 'Lincoln' are historically inaccurate — particularly the scene where Lincoln dies in the mouth of a great white shark." –Conan O'Brien “In the afterlife, people never forget to feed the dog.” - Halldór Laxness "Ah, ambiguity... the devil's volleyball!" - Emo Philips "Pope Benedict is quitting. That's a tall hat to fill… He had a press conference today. He said he just wants to spend more time with his wife and kids." - David Letterman “The only way to abolish war is to make peace heroic.” – James Hinton “It is far easier to learn science first and philosophy later than the other way round!” – Harvey Brown, Professor, Philosophy of Physics, Oxford "Be honest. How many of you never heard of Marco Rubio until last night? How many thought Marco Rubio was a game you played in a pool with the kids?" –Jay Leno “If the anti-abortion movement took a tenth of the energy they put into noisy theatrics and devoted it to improving the lives of children who have been born into lives of poverty, violence, and neglect, they could make a world shine.” – Michael Tucker

Message.Title: AHQ (final)...
Message.Msg: ... “Look at everything as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time.” – Betty Smith “It’s hard for me to take your despair very seriously, Doctor. You obviously enjoy it so much.” – Paddy Chayefsky “In many matters children — not ensnared by dogmatism, passion, or erudition — judge far truer than adults.” – Adolph Freiherr Knigge "Actually, when the voting's done, the cardinals burn their ballots. People wait outside the Sistine Chapel to see what color the smoke is. If it's white smoke, they've agreed on a Pope. If it's black smoke, no decision's been made. If it's green smoke, Willie Nelson has somehow gotten into the Sistine Chapel." - Craig Ferguson “Did you ever wake up with an erection...and then you realize you're just in a massage chair at Brookstone? And you yell to the sales clerk ‘I'll take it’!” – Zach Galifianakis "Scientists have found the remains of England's King Richard III under a parking lot. Unfortunately, they couldn't find his ticket. So he'll be charged the day rate." - Conan O'Brien “Go placidly amid the noise and haste, and remember what peace there may be in silence.” – Max Ehrmann “I know that I am mortal by nature and ephemeral, but when I trace at my pleasure the windings to and fro of the heavenly bodies, I no longer touch earth with my feet. I stand in the presence of Zeus himself and take my fill of ambrosia.” – Ptolemy “Banana Joe, a little affenpinscher, who won The Westminster Dog Show, is being treated like royalty today in New York. This afternoon, he went to a steakhouse. Then he gets to spend the rest of the week serving as Donald Trump's toupee." –Craig Ferguson “A man is a very small thing, and the night is very large and full of wonders.” – Lord Dunsany “Have a good weekend, all.” – echo2165 “Knowledge is soon changed, then lost in the mist, an echo half-heard.” – Gene Wolfe

The Box Under Bill & Hillary's Bed When Bill and Hillary Clinton first got married Bill said, "I am putting a box under the bed. You must promise never to look in it." In all their 30 years of marriage, Hillary never looked. On the afternoon of their 30th anniversary, curiosity got the best of her and she lifted the lid and peeked inside. In the box were 3 empty beer cans and $81,874.25 in cash. She closed the box and put it back under the bed. Now that she knew what was in the box, she was doubly curious as to why there even was such a box with such contents. That evening, they were out for a special anniversary dinner. After dinner, Hillary could no longer contain her curiosity and she confessed, saying, "I am so sorry, Bill. For all these years, I kept my promise and never looked into the box under our bed. However, today the temptation was too much and I gave in. But now I need to know, why do you keep the 3 beer cans in the box?" Bill thought for a while and said, "I guess after all these years you deserve to know the truth. Whenever I was unfaithful to you, I put an empty beer can in the box under the bed to remind myself not to do it again." Hillary was shocked, but said, "Hmmm, Jennifer, Paula and Monica. I am very disappointed and saddened by your behavior. However, since you are addicted to sex I guess it does happen and I guess 3 times is not that bad considering your problem." Bill thanked her for being so understanding. They hugged and made their peace. A little while later Hillary asked Bill, "So why do you have all that money in the box?" Bill answered: "Well, whenever the box filled up with empty cans, I took them to the recycling center and redeemed them for cash."

... “Today, Chicago is the a (sic) killing field of America…It is interesting to note that Chicago, and Illinois for that matter, have been run by Democrats since anyone can remember. They can't blame their mess on Republicans.” –t.bfine Is it “a” killing field? It’s comparable to many urban areas. Is it “the” killing field? Hardly. It’s not even in the top 15. Do you people ever attempt to actually do any research about anything you say? If you need to try to make a political point that all murderers are motivated by political affiliation, so be it. I’m certain that many other socio-economic factors enter into it, but that would require some actual thinking on your part, which, as Bobby Jindall has told you, is not your strong suit. “Perhaps the President visited Chicago yesterday to say bye to Jesse and his wife before they head for the federal pen.” – t.bfine Or, perhaps they were just going home for a visit. Crime statistics are listed for U.S. cities with a population of 250,000 or greater. Rates are based on cases per 100,000 people for all of calendar year 2011. Murder and nonnegligent manslaughter: New Orleans 57.6 Detroit 48.2 St. Louis 35.3 Newark 33.8 Baltimore 31.3 Oakland 26.3 Kansas City 23.4 Philadelphia 21.2 Atlanta 20.7 Cincinnati 20.5 Stockton 19.7 Cleveland 18.6 Memphis 17.9 D. C. 17.5 Miami 16.8 Chicago 15.9
Too bad George W Bush was AWOL during Viet Nam. Must have had too much coke in his system to pass the pilots mandatory drug tests.
Tell it to the 500 plus folks murdered in Chicago in 2012. Better yet, tell it to the parents of 15-year-old Hadiya Pendleton who was murdered this year.
Funny, you don't mention his dad.

Fools think corruption is partisan. I will say though that corruption seems to run deeper with those calling themselves "Democrat". Most of those that go to prisdon do so because they have crossed the wrong people, not because of any intrinsic "justice" in the system.

... “Tell it to the 500 plus folks murdered in Chicago in 2012. Better yet, tell it to the parents of 15-year-old Hadiya Pendleton who was murdered this year.” – t.bfine And, still better yet, why don’t you tell them how your Texas Tea People support wacky Congressman Steve Stockman who threatened to file articles of impeachment against Mr. Obama if the president issued executive orders that strengthened gun control laws. I’m certain that the Pendleton family would find real solace in knowing that you folks want to politicize her death, while doing everything in your power to defeat any type of constructive gun control legislation.

You know Echo, you're getting almost as good as Ricky at deflection. Just for the record, the far left was the first to "politicize" her death in support of Obama's plans. By the way, Tea Party and all, I do support some further forms of gun control e.g., universal background checks, enforcement of EXISTING law and the beefing up of penalties for gun law violations. Let's agree to put violators away for a very, very long time. That may be one of the few remedies that might work simply because we will be taking the clowns off the street. My guess is the Left won't like that. It's too harsh, don't ya know. Better yet, let's treat them like we do here in Texas because if they murder someone like Hadiya here in cold blood, there is a good chance it will be their last murder. Get my meaning? On that I suspect the Left will complain that her shooting was an "accident" i.e., they accidentally killed the wrong person. Too bad, I say. Let's get serious about going after these people with a vengeance.

Message.Title: Is POTUS reading the T message board?
Message.Msg: I'm sure many of you remember how furious our little friends were when I made this statement a few days ago: "But I am facinated by the city that our "dear leader" calls home. I am also facinated by the inability of the National media (i.e., ABC, CBS, NBC,, CNN, etc.) to report any news regarding this city's inability to govern and control crime. Remember last month Chicago had the equivalent of two Sandy Hook shooting events whithin the city limits. What did we hear from the National media? crickets How many news conferences has our "dear leader" given where the National media has asked about what his recommendations are for reducing murders in the city of his home. I know you like truth and facts, I do too, but I also like to investigate and point out hypocricy when I find it, because we all know that if the National media finds news that places our "dear leader" in a less than positive light, then the media will spike the story, or pretend that the events never occurred. Can you imagine if the home city of George W. Bush had the reputation that Chicago has? The drum beat for off with his head would be deafening." Well you could have knocked me over with a feather when I read the following: "Speaking in Chicago Friday, President Barack Obama pointed out the high number of murders in that city last year included 65 persons under the age of 18, which is "the equivalent of a Newtown every four months." Remember the problems our little friends had with the word "equivalent". I wonder if now they will magically find that this word is the most appropriate use of the King's english. Honest folks you just can't make this stuff up. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

Silly ole fool. It's your "Holy One" that turned this into a Photo Op ,, preying on the children & their families .. especially the deceased !! You, like him, have no moral compass what so ever - you're a sad individual simply continuing his legacy as a "photo-op freak" .. still preying on the families of the victims for his personal political gain .. shame on you !! I too support "gun control", but NOT the leftist view of prohibiting law biding citizen from defending themselves with equal force of semi-auto weapons !!
.. "Although I am a poor judge of omelettes .. I am able to lay many goose-eggs" - EGGO

All this echo knows is the tea party...that is all he talks about .He calls them liars and folks that deceive ...get a grip dude ...they are in someways correct !!!! You list cities murder rates...LOOK AT THE DEMOGRAPHICS of those towns and that will tell it all !!!!

This un-named Instructor pulled his serivce weapon, in the heat of the moment, during training, and shot the Officer in the forehead, at point blank range. The 40 year old, new to Police work, is in serious condition. No live weapons were to be used in the exercise. Many common sense rules were violated.
